page.title: 05INTERESTING FEATURES (CONT.)
page.content: {THE TOLSEY HOUSE.}SITUATED ON THE CORNER OF HIGH ST. AND MARKET ST. STANDS THIS OLD SQUARE RED BRICK BUILDING WITH A TILED PYRAMIDAL ROOF SURMOUNTED BY A CUPOLA ABOVE WHICH SWINGS A WEATHERCOCK. THE PROJECTING CLOCK IS A JUBILEE (1897) MEMORIAL. IT WAS A MARKET TOLL HOUSE AND SERVED AS A COURT DEALING WITH OFFENCES AGAINST MARKET REGULATIONS.{THE TABERNACLE {CHAPEL. }THIS CHAPEL WITH ITS PROMINENT SPIRE STANDING AT THE TOP OF TABERNACLE PITCH WAS FOUNDED BY ROWLAND HILL IN 1771. MARGINALLY OUTSIDE THE D_BLOCK STAND TWO BUILDINGS OF GREAT HISTORICAL INTEREST: THE 11TH CENT.{RAM INN} REPUTED TO HAVE HOUSED THE MASONS WHO BUILT THE NEARBY PARISH CHURCH OF{ST. {MARY THE VIRGIN}(1283). HELEN PORTER AGE 11
